page.title: 10Employment in Papworth
page.content:
The village is unique as most of the population is employed by Papworth Village Industries, which were established by the Trust. The principal industries are printing and leatherwork, but there are others. They also employ able-bodied people from outside the Settlement, but are primarily there for the handicapped people. The whole is a registered charity and so any profits made go back to the Trust.
Some members of the village are employed in the Hospital, which is now under the control of the National Health Service.
